metadata.calibration_source: WA DOH Respiratory Illness Dashboard, CDC RSV-NET, Pierce County Vaccination Data (2024-2025 season)
data_sources: WA DOH respiratory illness surveillance dashboard
WA DOH Table 3: RSV vaccination coverage by county (2024-2025)
metadata.notes: Pierce County calibrated parameters for 2024-2025 RSV season. Very strong seasonal patterns (factor: 3.5, highest of three diseases). Pediatric-focused disease with children 0-17 at 5.0x baseline risk. NEW RSV vaccine available for elderly 75+ (46.1% coverage in Pierce County), but overall population coverage only ~15% due to limited eligibility. Peak: Mid-November through December (weeks 47-52), earlier than flu/COVID. Very low mortality (0.03% CFR), primarily affects infants <6 months and elderly 75+. See Docs/Pierce_County_Disease_Parameters_2025.md for full documentation.

model_validation.vaccination_impact: Limited (15% coverage overall, 46.1% in eligible elderly 75+, new vaccine)
model_validation.pediatric_focus: High (5.0x risk for children 0-17, especially infants <6 months)
